and
are available, to set text in a lighter or bolder font as compared to its surrounding text.

If Apple News can’t find a font variant with the given specifications in the provided font family, it selects an alternative with the closest match. If Apple News doesn’t find a bold/bolder font, it doesn’t create a faux-bold alternative, and instead uses the closest match. Similarly, if Apple News can’t find an italic or oblique font variant, it won’t slant text or make it appear italicized.

abstract.text: Learn about new features that require iOS 17, iPadOS 17, and macOS 14.

doc://com.apple.applenews/documentation/.title: Apple News Format Release Notes for iOS 17, iPadOS 17, and macOS 14

abstract.text: Choose a font family for Apple News Format that’s supported in iOS, iPadOS, and macOS.
Understand the types of components that can make up an article.
Create an article with text components and component text styles.
Define and apply custom, default, and inline text styles, or use HTML tags or Markdown syntax to style your text.
Improve the appearance of the text and components in your article by using Apple News Format styles.
Understand basic JSON concepts and become familiar with the structure of an Apple News Format article.
Align article components with columns in your layout.

The component for adding the publication date or contributor credits, especially for articles with multiple contributors.
The component for adding caption text.

The object for applying text styling when not using HTML or Markdown formatting.
The object for defining the style for bulleted or numbered lists in an article.
